Class DungeonAdventure

java.lang.Object
DungeonAdventure
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DungeonAdventure extends Object implements Serializable
Is the main logic of the game, similar to Controller in MVC. @author: Toan Nguyen
See Also:

    • init

    • getInstance

      public static DungeonAdventure getInstance()
      A part of the Singleton design. Return the instance of DungeonAdventure
      Returns:
      the instance of DungeonAdventure

    • createANewGame

      void createANewGame(String theHeroName, int theHeroClass, int theDifficultyLevel)
      Creating a new game
      Parameters:
      theHeroName - the player's name
      theHeroClass - the player's class
      theDifficultyLevel - difficulty of the game

    • checkValid

      static boolean checkValid(int theXCoordinate, int theYCoordinate)
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if coordinate [i,j] is within the border of the map, false otherwise

    • randomizeMap

      void randomizeMap()
      Initialize the map, build the maze (With custom access) Algorithm to implement a maze generator Choose the initial cell, mark it as visited and push it to the stack While the stack is not empty Pop a cell from the stack and make it a current cell If the current cell has any neighbours which have not been visited Push the current cell to the stack

      Remove the wall between the current cell and the chosen cell

    • getWorldMapFullVisibility

      String getWorldMapFullVisibility()
      Returns:
      a String, as the whole map X means no access, ' ' means there is a way S is the entrance P is current location of player Full visibility is only used for testing purposes

    • parseWorldMapWithVisibility

      String parseWorldMapWithVisibility()
      Returns:
      a String, as the whole map but will conceal room where player has not visited + means no access, ' ' means there is a way Room has not been visited will not show up P is current location of player

    • movePlayer

      void movePlayer(int theDirection)
      Move the player in the according direction. Will not move if the new location is invalid
      Parameters:
      theDirection - the direction wishes to move the player to (0: North, 1: East, 2: South, 3: West)

    • returnPlayerToPreviousPos

      void returnPlayerToPreviousPos()
      Move the player back into the previous location. Won't move if it is the start of the game (Previous room is null) Used only for the fleeing function

    • getCurrentRoomAccessCode

      byte getCurrentRoomAccessCode()
      The code is byte (8 bit) with the bit from 0th to 3rd signify whether the room has access to the corresponding direction 0th is for North, 1st is for East, 2nd is for South, 3rd is for West If the bit is 1, the room has access. If it is 0, the room doesn't have access to that direction.
      Returns:
      int, as the access code

    • getRoomAccessCode

      byte getRoomAccessCode(int theXPos, int theYPos)
      The code is byte (8 bit) with the bit from 0th to 3rd signify whether the room has access to the corresponding direction 0th is for North, 1st is for East, 2nd is for South, 3rd is for West If the bit is 1, the room has access. If it is 0, the room doesn't have access to that direction.
      Parameters:
      theXPos - the desired room's x position
      theYPos - the desired room's y position
      Returns:
      int, as the access code

    • getMapSizeWidth

      int getMapSizeWidth()
      Width of the map
      Returns:
      an int that is the width of the map

      Height of the map
      Returns:

    • getRoomVisitedStatus

      boolean getRoomVisitedStatus(int theXPos, int theYPos)
      Return whether a room is visited or not
      Parameters:
      theXPos - the desired room's x position
      theYPos - the desired room's y position
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if the room has been visited, false otherwise

    • setPlayerPosition

      void setPlayerPosition(int theXPos, int theYPos)
      Set the player's position, only used for testing Do nothing if the new location is invalid
      Parameters:

      theYPos - the player's y position
